header_summary:
Matt Corallo highlights the challenges Bitcoin pooled mining faces, such as block withholding attacks that miners execute by submitting shares without producing valid blocks. This practice, which undermines the pool's success, can be detected through increased computational efforts and statistical analysis, emphasizing the pools' need for robust defense mechanisms. Corallo also criticizes the potential undermining of Bitcoin's decentralization through Stratum V2's work selection process, advocating for miners' autonomy in selecting work to preserve the network's decentralized nature ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/26322ee8-08e6-4718-8d1c-60bca8c13c6a@mattcorallo.com/T/#m0a18615b7f96af4c21a5ce4207b435a6c476a1f1)).

Cory Fields reports on Hennadii Stepanov's effort to transition Bitcoin Core's build system from Autotools to CMake, aiming for integration after the v28 feature-freeze. This change, expected to streamline the development process and encourage community feedback, highlights the development team's preference for modernizing the project's infrastructure while maintaining support for older branches. The adoption of CMake reflects a broader strategy to enhance Bitcoin Core's build efficiency and developer experience, with the community encouraged to participate in the transition ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/6cfd5a56-84b4-4cbc-a211-dd34b8942f77n@googlegroups.com/T/#u#m4526371f167fea9fe6a681f529d7ac400cb35906)).

Discussions around the mitigation of Distributed Denial of Service (DoS) threats through onion messages in Bitcoin's network and the vulnerabilities in cryptocurrency wallets' user interface designs were also prominent. The former addresses the lack of formal analysis on DoS risks but notes the implementation of a "backpressure" mitigation strategy. In contrast, the latter conversation explores the risks and design considerations in associating contact information with payment codes, emphasizing the need for clear communication and secure practices to prevent deceptive practices and ensure transaction security ([source 1](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/onion-messaging-dos-threat-mitigations/1058/2), [source 2](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/bolt-12-trusted-contacts/1046/5))

recent_posts.title: Mining pools, stratumv2 and oblivious shares
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin pooled mining is vulnerable to block withholding attacks by submitting shares without blocks.
- Detection relies on statistical analysis to identify anomalies indicative of withholding behavior.
- Stratum V2 aims for decentralized work selection, ensuring miners' autonomy and reinforcing Bitcoin's decentralization.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core's migration to the CMake buildsystem

- Hennadii Stepanov is leading Bitcoin Core's build system transition from Autotools to CMake.

recent_posts.title: Onion Messaging DoS Threat Mitigations
recent_posts.summary:
- The paper discusses reducing DoS threats in onion messages without proving their existence.
- It focuses on preventing routing loops, a major concern, but lacks formal risk analysis.
- Lightning developers agreed on a "backpressure" strategy for potential DoS issues, yet details are sparse.

recent_posts.title: Bolt 12 Trusted Contacts
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses vulnerabilities in cryptocurrency wallets and user interface design considerations.
- It highlights the risk of associating wrong contact information with payment codes, leading to potential fund losses.
- The importance of educating users on secure payment practices and the challenges of key compromise are emphasized.

recent_posts.title: Stats on compact block reconstructions
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core's specialized pool aids in compact block reconstructions.
- The `-blockreconstructionextratxn` parameter helps by retaining 100 extra transactions.
- This approach targets blockchain efficiency, differing from mempool size impacts.

active_posts.title: Mining pools, stratumv2 and oblivious shares
active_posts.summary:
- Stratum V2's template distribution via client push poses block withholding attack risks for mining pools.
- A proposed solution is a negotiated template approach, aiming to secure and democratize access.
- The email suggests altering the PoW algorithm and expanding nonce space to enhance mining operations.

active_posts.title: Bitcoin Core's migration to the CMake buildsystem
active_posts.summary:
- Hennadii Stepanov has led the shift of Bitcoin Core's build system to CMake.
- The CMake integration enhances the software and its dependencies, benefiting the open-source community.

active_posts.title: Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
active_posts.summary:
- The analysis suggests improving Bitcoin by addressing vulnerabilities and inefficiencies for enhanced security.
- Proposed solutions include adjusting mining difficulty and imposing constraints on legacy transactions to mitigate risks.
- Community debate arises over suggestions like reducing block size, highlighting concerns on scalability and efficiency.

active_posts.title: Zawy’s Alternating Timestamp Attack
active_posts.summary:
- Zawy's Alternating Timestamp Attack exploits Bitcoin Testnet 4 by manipulating block timestamps.
- The attack allows significantly faster block production by altering difficulty adjustments.
- To counter such tactics, a softfork proposing stricter timestamp requirements has been discussed.

active_posts.title: Stable Channels - peer-to-peer dollar balances on Lightning
active_posts.summary:
- Stable Channels integrates bitcoin with the Lightning network for dollar stability.
- It allows trading and liquidity enhancement on Lightning without centralized risks.
- The project faces challenges but lays the groundwork for a stable cryptocurrency ecosystem.

today_in_history_posts.summary:
